info.name: backend-v3
info.description:
Mika backend version 3 - ongoing development

## Content-type
Mika backend api **ONLY** accept and response in `application/json` media type

## Response structure
```json
{
    "version": "master-29ad0b0-35 development 2019-04-25T11:02:25.000Z",
    "status": "sys-200",
    "message": "Success",
    "isError": false,
    "data": "Welcome to backend-v3"
}
```

All response in mika backend, will contain, 

- `version`
Contain current revison of backend, with format 
```
{{branch}}-{{commitHash}}-{{commitCount}} {{enviroment}} {{commitTime}}
```

- `status`
Contain machine friendly error status code. It complement HTTP status code.

- `message`
Contain human friendly error status code.

- `isError`
Telling wheter this type of response is an error or not

- `data`
If any data is included, it will be in `data`.

- `meta`
Sometime `meta` could be included to complement `data`


## Authentication
Authentication is needed for all non-debug endpoints or unless noted in individual endpoints. To authenticate, please login via respective endpoint in **Authentication** collection.

In every request, session token needs to be included in `x-access-token` HTTP header.

Mika backend uses session with long expiry (at least 3 days). Expiry will renewed on every request made to aunthenticated endpoint. 

Only one session token valid for one login user. Any login to same user will invalidate last session token. 

## Debug
Debug endpoint is only available in development or staging enviroment. To authenticate, please include debug key in `x-mika-debug` http header.

## Common Query
### Prequisites : Attributes/Fields
Attributes name in `filters` and `order_by` is one to one to entity model, for example simplified `transaction` entity under agent will have,
```json
{
  "id": "1LGN6V6a7b4YGBVK5kqt3D7u8iM",
  "idAlias": "agromesupermoe-15MRA6-NCMPW5",
  "amount": 1000,
  "status": "created",
  "settlementStatus": "",
  "createdAt": "2019-05-15T08:51:39.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2019-05-15T08:51:39.000Z",
  "transactionExtraKvs": [],
  "acquirer": {
    "id": 8,
    "name": "WeChat Pay Super Moe",
    "acquirerConfigId": 3,
    "acquirerTypeId": 4,
    "acquirerType": {
      "id": 4,
      "class": "alipay",
      "thumbnailGray": "alipay-gray.png",
      "chartColor": "#01AAEE"
    },
    "acquirerConfig": {
      "id": 3,
      "sandbox": true,
      "merchantId": null
    }
  }
}
```
to select `class` under `acquirerType`, attributes name `acquirer.acquirerType.class`can be used

### Pagination and Ordering
Pagination and ordering is supported for plural words endpoint (e.g `/api/agent/transactions`). With Exception when resource identifier is explicitly written in endpoint (e.g `/api/agent/transactions/sdjkflnas12389d`).

Query parameter for pagination and ordering :
 - `page` : current page
 - `per_page` : entities per page
 - `get_count` : get total count of entites, placed in `meta`
 - `order` : order direction, `asc` for ascending and `desc` for descending
 - `order_by`: attributes in entities as order parameter
### Filters
Most plural endpoint provide capability to filter entities, including specific endpoint if noted. Filters is defined as array of query string (e.g `filters[]`) that formatted with
`attributes,op,value`

Operator supported by `filters[]`
- `eq` (equal)
- `eqnull` (equal null)
- `ne` (not equal)
- `lt`, `lte` (less than, less than equal)
- `gt`, `gte` (greater that, greater than equal)
- `like` (like wildcard)

Example: 
- `filters[]=status,eq,succes`
- `filters[]=acquirer.name,like,%tcash%`

request.description:

`username` and `password`.

`userTypes` is an array of user type to enforce for login user. If user whom login is not in `userTypes`, login will simply fail.
